info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 11:55PM EDT until April 6 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following waterways in Indiana...
Sugar Creek at New Palestine and near Edinburgh.
East Fork White River at Columbus and Seymour.
Flatrock River near Columbus.
Muscatatuck River at Vernon.
Eel River at Bowling Green.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
East Fork White River at Williams, near Bedford, near Rivervale, and at Shoals.
.Excessive rainfall from repeated rounds of showers and thunderstorms, which will continue well into the weekend, is bringing up water levels on waterways across Indiana. Significant and some major flooding is expected to develop along the East Fork White River. The crest on the East Fork should be in the Columbus and Seymour areas Sunday evening into Monday and points downstream thereafter.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...Sugar Creek at New Palestine.
* WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Extensive lowland flooding in progress along Sugar Creek in New Palestine area. Local river roads closed by high water. Flooding of some residential property and backyards begins.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EDT Friday was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Saturday afternoon by around 300 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON
